name: Graylog Community: Windows Applocker
description: This content pack leverages implementing an Application Whitelisting Approach.

summary.@value: This Dashboard aggregates all available information collected from Windows Endpoints regarding applications controlled by Applocker.

description.@value: Microsoft provides Applocker as solution to enforce Application Whitelisting. This allows to fully control Applications and Scripts being executed on all Windows Systems being managed by Applocker. This Dashboard provides insights to proactively enabling all required applications as well as identifying attempts to run unauthorized executables.

source.@value:
pipeline "Windows - Applocker - Ingestion"
stage 20 match either
rule "Windows - Applocker - NXLog - Normalization 21"
rule "Windows - Applocker - Winlogbeat - Normalization 22"
rule "Windows - Applocker - Winlogbeat - Normalization 23"
stage 30 match either
rule "Windows - AppLocker - Parsing 33"
rule "Windows - AppLocker - Parsing 34"
rule "Windows - Applocker - Parsing 36"
rule "Windows - Applocker - Parsing 37"
rule "Windows - Applocker - Parsing 38"
stage 40 match either
rule "Windows - Applocker - Enrichment 43"
stage 50 match all
rule "Windows - Applocker - Enrichment 51"
rule "Windows - Applocker - Enrichment 52"
stage 80 match either
rule "Windows - Applocker - Routing 81"
rule "Windows - Applocker - Routing 82"
stage 90 match either
rule "Windows - Applocker - Cleanup 92"
rule "Windows - Applocker - Cleanup 93"
rule "Windows - Applocker - Cleanup 94"
end

description.@value: Setting Field "hash_sha256" for logs containing "file_path" from sha256 calculation

source.@value:
rule "Windows - Applocker - Enrichment 43"

when
    to_string($message.event_provider) == "Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker" AND
    has_field("file_path")

then
    set_field(
        field:"hash_sha256",
        value: sha256(to_string($message.file_path))
    );
    
end

description.@value: Setting Field "application_category" for 8002 - 8007, 8020 - 8025 from "windows-applocker-whitelist" based on "hash_sha256"
Cleaning up Fields for Winlogbeat collected Logs (without "winlogbeat_" prefix)
Cleaning up Fields for Winlogbeat collected Logs (with "winlogbeat_" prefix)

source.@value:
rule "Windows - Applocker - Cleanup 94"

when
    to_string($message.event_provider) == "Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker" AND
    to_string($message.winlogbeat_agent_type) == "winlogbeat"
    
then
    remove_field("^winlogbeat_.*");
    remove_field("tags");
end

description.@value: Removing from Stream "Illuminate:Windows Event Log Messages" identified by Name

source.@value:
rule "Windows - Applocker - Routing 82"

when
    to_string($message.event_provider) == "Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker" 

then
    remove_from_stream(
        name: "Illuminate:Windows Event Log Messages"
    );
    
end

description.@value: Cleaning up Fields for NXLog collected Logs
Setting Field "event_action" as "warned" on Applocker EventID 8003, 8006, 8021, 8024

source.@value:
rule "Windows - Applocker - Parsing 37"
when
    to_string($message.event_provider) == "Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker" AND
    (
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8003 OR
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8006 OR
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8021 OR
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8024
    ) 
    
then
    set_field(
        field: "event_action",
        value: "warned"
    );
    
end

description.@value: Setting Field "event_action" as "blocked" on Applocker EventID 8004, 8007, 8022, 8025

source.@value:
rule "Windows - Applocker - Parsing 38"
when
    to_string($message.event_provider) == "Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker" AND
    (
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8004 OR
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8007 OR
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8022 OR
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8025
    ) 
    
then
    set_field(
        field: "event_action",
        value: "blocked"
    );
    
end

description.@value: Setting Field "event_action" as "allowed" on Applocker EventID 8002, 8005, 8020, 8023

source.@value:
rule "Windows - Applocker - Parsing 36"
when
    to_string($message.event_provider) == "Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker" AND
    (
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8002 OR
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8005 OR
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8020 OR
        to_long($message.event_code) == 8023
    ) 
    
then
    set_field(
        field: "event_action",
        value: "allowed"
    );
    
end

description.@value: Routing to Stream "Windows - Applocker" identified by Name

source.@value:
rule "Windows - Applocker - Routing 81"

when
    to_string($message.event_provider) == "Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker" 
    
then
    route_to_stream(
        name: "Windows - AppLocker",
        remove_from_default: true
    );
    
end

default_template.@value:
# Needed for Graylog
fields_under_root: true
fields.collector_node_id: ${sidecar.nodeName}
fields.gl2_source_collector: ${sidecar.nodeId}

output.logstash:
  # add the name of your own Graylog Cluster here
  hosts: ["graylog.demo.io:5044"]
path:
  data: ${sidecar.spoolDir!"C:\\Program Files\\Graylog\\sidecar\\cache\\winlogbeat"}\data
  logs: ${sidecar.spoolDir!"C:\\Program Files\\Graylog\\sidecar"}\logs
tags:
  # tag specific for Applocker; additional tags can be added
  - applocker
winlogbeat:
  event_logs:
   # Applocker Logging
   - name: Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker/EXE and DLL
   - name: Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker/MSI and Script
   - name: Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker/Packaged app-Deployment
   - name: Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker/Packaged app-Execution

define ROOT C:\Program Files\Graylog\nxlog

Moduledir %ROOT%\modules
CacheDir %ROOT%\data
Pidfile %ROOT%\data\nxlog_applocker.pid
SpoolDir %ROOT%\data
LogFile %ROOT%\data\nxlog.log
LogLevel INFO

<Extension logrotate>
  Module  xm_fileop
    <Schedule>
      When    @daily
      Exec    file_cycle('%ROOT%\data\nxlog.log', 7);
     </Schedule>
</Extension>


<Extension gelfExt>
  Module xm_gelf
  ShortMessageLength 65536
</Extension>


<Extension json>
  Module  xm_json
</Extension>

# This Input defines the collection of ONLY Applocker Logs. Additional Windows Log Collection can be defined below or in a dedicated Collector. 
<Input appeventlog>
    Module im_msvistalog
    PollInterval 1
    SavePos True
    ReadFromLast True

    <QueryXML>
        <QueryList>
          <Query Id="0">
            <Select Path="Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker/EXE and DLL">*</Select>
            <Select Path="Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker/MSI and Script">*</Select>
            <Select Path="Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker/Packaged app-Deployment">*</Select>
            <Select Path="Microsoft-Windows-AppLocker/Packaged app-Execution">*</Select>
          </Query>
        </QueryList>
    </QueryXML>
</Input>

# Define your own Graylog Cluster in the section below (Module[udp|tcp], Name, Port)
<Output gelf>
	Module om_tcp
	Host graylog.demo.io
	Port 12201
	OutputType  GELF_TCP
	<Exec>
	  # These fields are needed for Graylog
	  $gl2_source_collector = '${sidecar.nodeId}';
	  $collector_node_id = '${sidecar.nodeName}';
	  # Agent Type was added for Applocker Parsers to work properly
	  $agent_type = 'nxlog';
	</Exec>
</Output>


<Route route-1>
  Path appeventlog => gelf
</Route>

# Define your own Graylog Cluster in the section below (Module[udp|tcp], Name, Port)
<Output gelf>
	Module om_tcp
	Host graylog.demo.io
	Port 12201  
	OutputType  GELF_TCP
	<Exec>
	  # These fields are needed for Graylog
	  $gl2_source_collector = '${sidecar.nodeId}';
	  $collector_node_id = '${sidecar.nodeName}';
	  # Agent Type was added for Applocker Parsers to work properly
	  $agent_type = 'nxlog'
	</Exec>
</Output>


<Route route-1>
  Path appeventlog => gelf
</Route>

description.@value: Default Windows Event Log Messages. Contains all Windows Event Log messages not routed to other streams.
